comment.author: 80878055@N00
comment._content: The Kimmitt family had firstly a painting and decorating business in Armagh but later also restored paintings and branched into portrait painting for local clientèle. Belo are some links to PRONI's online business directories listing Kimmitt. streetdirectories.proni.gov.uk/aetopia/WebObjects/StreetD... streetdirectories.proni.gov.uk/aetopia/WebObjects/StreetD... streetdirectories.proni.gov.uk/aetopia/WebObjects/StreetD... streetdirectories.proni.gov.uk/aetopia/WebObjects/StreetD...

comment.author: 66531096@N03
comment._content: Does anyone know the name of the Kimmitt's in this picture?

comment.author: 55770107@N02
comment._content:
Here is the family of Edward Gilbert Kimmitt in the 1911 census, though it doesn't seem to quite match up with the photograph: (http://www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1911/Armagh/Armagh_South_Urban/Dobbin_Street/324698/ : accessed 4 Apr 2011
Residents of a house 8 in Dobbin Street (Armagh South Urban, Armagh)
Kimmitt, Edward G, 50, Male, Head of Family, Church of Ireland, Master Painter
Kimmitt, Eva Florence, 38, Female, Wife, Church of Ireland
Kimmitt, Eileen Maude, 16, Female, Daughter, Church of Ireland
Kimmitt, Walter Joseph, 15, Male, Son, Church of Ireland, Apprentice Painter
Kimmitt, Cecilia Florence, 5 mos., Female, Daughter, Church of Ireland
Reilly, Maggie, 19, Female, Servant, Roman Catholic
Willers, Jack, 2, Male, Nephew, Church of Ireland

comment.author: 92916829@N08
comment._content:
I am related to Edward G. Kimmitt--this photo was take more likely about 1913-14.

1901 Ireland Census, County Armagh, 31 Dobbin St. , Armagh
Edward Gilbert Kimmitt (E.G. Kimmitt) 40, Church of Ireland
Eva Florence Kimmitt 28
Eileen Maud Kimmitt 6
Walter Joseph Kimmitt 5
Edward Andrew Kimmitt 3
In the 1911 census Edward Andrew Kimmitt age 13 was visiting his grandfather, Thomas Cowan on Abbey St. in Armagh the day the c1911 census was taken. That is why he was not in pfkimmitt's comment.
